instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.LP8550: What is LP8550? This is an LED driver responsible for creating the backlight on the LCD screen of Macbooks from 2011 through 2015.
definitions.BKL_PWM: What is BKL_PWM? BKL_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing backlight
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing backlight
Liquid damage arround lvds. I replaced LVDS connector and now I have 39.6V at lvds pin 3,4. I can see blinking folder using lantern.
39.6V is enought? This mean <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> (<CHIP>LP8550</CHIP>) is working well?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing backlight
threads.message: Check <SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL>. Is LCD cable not burned?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing backlight
threads.message: LCD cable looks pretty good. Can I connect another screen to test? I dont have macbook air screen for 2013-2014 year. I have Air 2012 and MBP 2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing backlight
threads.message: 2012 Air assembly should work. Read my question again and check that too. LCD must be plugged when measuring anything.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing backlight
threads.message: I checked at <RESISTOR>R7704</RESISTOR> and I have 3.3V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing backlight
threads.message: Then there is no continuity between the backlight pins and the LCD. 39.6V is way too high and indicates that there is no load on the rails. Could be badly soldered connector or a bad LCD/LCD cable.
